abstract: Cara Goldenberg, co-founder of hedge fund Permian Investment Partners, nabbed a dinner date with Warren E. Buffett, the world’s second-richest man, by treating him to some of her research, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: Cara Goldenberg, co-founder of hedge fund Permian Investment Partners, nabbed a dinner date with Warren E. Buffett, the world’s second-richest man, by treating him to some of her research, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: One way to score a meal with Warren E. Buffett is to cough up $1.68 million, like a Canadian wealth management firm did to win a charity auction of a steak lunch with the famed investor.

headline.main: Manager Scores Dinner With Buffett, His Treat
